document_data.name: Shadow Druids
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Shadow Druids''' were a militant sect of [[druid]]s that operated throughout the [[Sword Coast]] and [[Amn]] during the 14{{th}} and 15{{th}} centuries [[DR]]. {{quote|''Balance is a myth. Where any clan treads, nature struggles.
Unity is a fiction. Men of mere flesh seek only to tame beast and raze flora.
We are thunder, and we are rain. We shatter mankind, and grow new life in its place.''|The excerpt from ''[[Faldorn's Canticle: The Shadow Druid's Doctrine|Faldorn's Canticle]]''.}}
document_data.Organization: The druidic circle as a whole was led by the [[archdruid|Shadow Archdruid]], while "First Druids" served as the leaders of individual groves.
document_data.Activities: Their guiding belief was that there was a long and endless struggle between people and nature. The tenets of their order were outlined in ''[[Faldorn's Canticle: The Shadow Druid's Doctrine]]''.
document_data.Tactics: They used extreme methods and violence to drive away civilization, using the ferocious powers of nature.

History.15{{th}} Century:
In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, there emerged the threat of a growing horde of [[goblinoid]]s, allied with [[drow]], [[gnoll]]s, and other monstrous creatures, which endangered druidic enclaves across the Sword Coast. Under the supervision of [[Aelis]], three druids of their order, [[Olodan]], [[Pinta]], and [[Wren (druid)|Wren]], infiltrated the [[Emerald Grove]] near the [[River Chionthar]] and took great pains to "protect" the grove from the rampaging goblins.

The group managed to corrupt the spirit of [[Kagha]], a senior member of the grove's druids, and manipulate her into carrying out the ''[[Rite of Thorns]]''. The powerful ritual would encase the Emerald Grove in a thicket of vines and brambles, shielding it away from any outsiders. The Shadow Druids would then take control of the grove itself, to further ensure its safety.
